meanings.definition: A device consisting of a twisted airfoil mounted on an aircraft for propelling it forward.
meanings.sent1: The airscrews on the plane spun rapidly, pushing it through the sky.
meanings.sent2: The pilot checked the airscrews before takeoff to ensure they were functioning properly.
meanings.sent3: The airscrews decided to have a race to see who could reach the clouds first.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination took flight, propelled by the airscrews of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the airscrews echoed across the airfield, announcing the arrival of the aircraft.

meanings.sent1: The shiny airscrews gleamed in the sunlight as the plane taxied on the runway.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic carefully inspected the airscrews for any signs of damage or wear.
meanings.sent3: The airscrews whispered secrets to each other as they spun in unison.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still as the airscrews sliced through the air with precision.
meanings.sent5: The pilot felt the power of the airscrews as the plane accelerated down the tarmac.
